page.title: 10Technology in Weaverthorpe
page.content: The earliest kinds of{mechanised {farm implements}were the first obvious signs of the{technological revolution. {Sewing machines}improved the women's lives. The{motor engine, telephone,} and{battery wireless}followed. Once {mains electricity, water, and drainage came to the area, Weaverthorpe caught up with the towns. The village has{no gas supply}but nearly every house has a telephone and all the modern equipment expected in towns.{Video recorders and computers} are becoming popular. There are still several C.B. enthusiasts. The{factory runs on electricity. {Farms are highly mechanised}and use large amounts of chemical{fertilisers, applied by tractor or aerially as the insecticide and fungicide sprays. Children, especially the boys, are fascinated by mechanical toys.
